Hawthorne.Ascot Park (speedway):
Ascot Park, originally Los Angeles Speedway, was a dirt racetrack located near Gardena, California.


== History ==
The Ascot Park track opened in 1957, as Los Angeles Speedway, on the site of a former city dump.
With seating for only 7,500, Ascot Park was smaller than the other tracks of the area including the Ontario Motor Speedway (closed in 1980), and the Riverside International Raceway (closed in 1989).
